dublin_core.dcvalue: BACKGROUND Mobile health applications are increasingly used in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease COPD to improve their self management nonetheless without firm evidence of their efficacy This meta analysis was aimed to assess the efficacy of mobile health applications in supporting self management as an intervention to reduce hospital admission rates and average days of hospitalization etc METHODS PubMed Web of Science SCI Cochrane Library and Embase were searched for relevant articles published before November 14th 2017 A total of 6 reports with randomized controlled trials RCTs were finally included in this meta analysis RESULTS Patients using mobile phone applications may have a lower risk for hospital admissions than those in the usual care group risk ratio RR 0 73 95 CI 0 52 1 04 However there was no significant difference in reducing the average days of hospitalization CONCLUSION Self management with mobile phone applications could reduce hospital admissions of patients with COPD
Mobile health applications in self-management of patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis of their efficacy.
